Does It Work?

install .exe found in torrent. 

Once installed and it asks you to register, skip through this section. click activate later. 

After the computer has rebooted load up Kaspersky, click on "Settings" and go down to "Options" and un-check
"Enable Self-Defence". 
Now disable Kaspersky and exit the program.

Next run regedit


 for Windows Vista Ultimate 64bit(most operating systems are similiar to this you can always search the registry for the keyword "Release"

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWARE/Wow6432Node/KasperskyLab/protected/AVP9/environment

Scroll down to Product Status and change from "Release" to "Beta"



LISTEN CAREFULLY
xit regedit and reload Kaspersky, you'll notice that when you goto the area where you 
normally input your key you now have an option to "Activate Beta Version".

Click this and you'll get a 30 day BETA trial, the great thing is you can just redo this time and again,
so 30 days later just click "Activate Beta Version" again and you'll get another 30 days. You only need to make the registry change once, not each time :)

You can re-enable Self Defence once you've edited the registry.


extincas4 aka 666BLADE

questions email me at 666bladetorrents@gmail.com

1. Disable the Self-Defense.
Open Kaspersky> Settings> "Options" or "service"> Disable the item "Enable Self-Defense"> OK
VERY IMPORTANTEE! You must go to "Options" or "Services" and uncheck the option "Enable Self Defense"!!!!!!!
-
2. Click the right mouse button on the Kaspersky icon near the clock and select Exit.
-
3. Open Notepad, copy and past the text below and save as KasperskyBeta.reg
Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\KasperskyLab\protected\AVP8\environment]
"ProductStatus"="Beta"
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\KasperskyLab\protected\AVP8\environment]
"ProductStatus"="Beta"
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\KasperskyLab\protected\AVP\environment]
"ProductStatus"="Beta"
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\KasperskyLab\protected\AVP7\environment]
"ProductStatus"="Beta"
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\KasperskyLab\protected\AVP7\environment]
"ProductStatus"="Beta"
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\KasperskyLab\protected\AVP9\environment]
"ProductStatus"="Beta"
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\KasperskyLab\protected\AVP9\environment]
"ProductStatus"="Beta"

4. Run KasperskyBeta.reg
-
5. Open the Kaspersky.
Go on Start> All Programs> Kaspersky
-
6. Enable the Self-Defense!
-
7. Go to the License
Delete the current key, if it exists.
Choose "Activate beta version"

what i found was that once the beta key expires
I repeated your instructions again, except in reverse
1) turn off self def-
2) close protection
3) go back to regedit, kaspersky lab environment avp9 blah blah
4) change product status back To "Release"
5) exit regedit, reload kaspersky
6) A message comes up saying your beta key isnt valid, and gives you a bunch of options, it should also show you the Beta key id along with a red "X". Click on it to delete your Beta key
8) Close kaspersky again after closing self-defence
9) go back to regedit, and change product status again to Beta
10) Open kaspersky, now when it asks you to activate your license and itll show the "Activate Beta License" option again :D
